summary: Cape Cod is a peninsula sticking out into the Atlantic Ocean from Massachusetts. It's known for its beaches and sea history, making it a popular summer tourist spot. Named by Bartholomew Gosnold in 1602, it's one of the oldest English place names in the U.S. Cape Cod is made up of 15 towns and is mostly separated from the mainland by the Cape Cod Canal, with only small parts of two towns connected to the mainland. Two bridges and a railroad bridge connect it to the mainland.
title: Cape Cod
